meanings.definition: To remove or reduce the criminal penalties for something.
meanings.sent1: The government decriminalized the possession of small amounts of marijuana.
meanings.sent2: The city council voted to decriminalize parking violations.
meanings.sent3: The town's decision to decriminalize jaywalking led to more people crossing the street wherever they pleased.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a weight had been lifted off her shoulders when the law decriminalized minor traffic offenses.
meanings.sent5: The new law decriminalizing littering made the streets cleaner almost overnight.

meanings.definition: To make something no longer illegal.
meanings.sent1: The recent legislation decriminalized the possession of certain drugs.
meanings.sent2: The activists' efforts finally led to the government decriminalizing public protests.
meanings.sent3: It was a relief when the authorities decided to decriminalize street vending in the city.
meanings.sent4: The decision to decriminalize street art brought a wave of creativity to the neighborhood.
meanings.sent5: The new policy decriminalizing homelessness aimed to provide support rather than punishment.
